overview: This subject provides a foundational overview of deliberate self-harm and suicide-related behaviours in young people, and presents a range of evidence-informed approaches to monitor, prevent and manage self-harm and suicide risk in community and clinical settings. Subject content includes:
The epidemiology of deliberate self-harm and suicidal behaviour in young people
Key theoretical frameworks for understanding youth self-harm and suicidal behaviour
Assessment of suicide and self-harm risk
Suicide prevention and postvention in non-clinical settings
intended learning outcomes: Describe the key risk and protective factors associated with youth self-harm and suicide
Examine key aspects of suicidal processes
Explain the concept of suicide clusters and methods to manage contagion
Evaluate population health approaches to suicide prevention for young people
Describe evidence-informed strategies for suicide prevention and postvention across a range of settings
Identify key elements of risk assessments for suicide and self-harm, and appraise the use of structured risk assessment tools

assessments.description: Online Quizzes of learning content – two multiple choice quizzes with 10 questions each = 20 questions in total (1% per question). 1000 words (equivalent)
Graded discussion board – posting fortnightly reflections on learning content and responding to fellow students, with a minimum of 7 posts in total. 1500-1975 words
